content.question: In a breeding pair of eukaryotic organisms, no crossing over occurs between chromatids of homologous chromosome pairs during either egg formation or sperm formation. Which of the following best explains the genetic makeup of the offspring produced when eggs are fertilized by sperm in this breeding pair?

choices.label: All offspring will be genetically identical to the parent that has the greatest number of dominant traits.
Half of the offspring will be genetically identical to one parent and the other half will be genetically identical to the other parent.
All offspring will be genetically different from each other and from the parents.
The zygotes from fertilization will not develop into any offspring because of nondisjunction.

content.answer: All offspring will be genetically different from each other and from the parents.
